name: suprememongoose
text: Roast Beef has impeccable taste in vehicles.

name: m3funkyb
text: this is the first Achewood strip I ever read, and I was hooked by the time I read the alt text

name: m3funkyb
text: A comment left by m3funkyb was marked as spam and excluded. m3funkyb: What a douche. (reported by jstegall, SSDDR, heatbag)

name: centipede_damascus
text: The Ford Galaxie was such an awesome car. They don't make cars that gangster anymore.

name: syrinx
text:
Alt: "Peel-Out Summer (US, 1981). Starring James Bolfiere, Carl Nolan and Timothy Shaw. A group of teenage friends spend their last summer together peeling out."

God, I wish this were a real movie. It would be at least half as good as The Born Losers.

name: straw
text: Chubby not for the upright alt-text service, but for that commentary

name: ttagxamm
text: Well I imagine "Peel-Out Summer" would be a much sweeter, more nostalgiac film, I'm pretty sure Ray would also enjoy " Two Lane Blacktop "

name: rhino
text: I really want to see that movie...

name: greyfield
text:
Yeah. Someone needs to make this movie. Or a remake of it. We don't see many remakes of fake films these days, and it feels like America is ready for a Peel-Out Summer.

Also, this car is damn sexy. Check it out: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:1965_Ford_Galaxie.jpg

name: fancyrat
text: I must find one.

name: fermatprime
text: You muft .

name: greenkoolayd
text: 'peel out summer' sounds to me like a cross between 'dazed and confused' and 'vanishing point'.

name: rolotonybrowntown
text: one of my favorite alt texts ever

name: rolotonybrowntown
text: also the wikipedia for this car and the subaru brat mention achewood

name: tetrisattack
text: I wonder if Ray got Lie Bot the DeLorian from Back To The Future. After all, he does have the Flux Capacitor.

name: mustakrakesh
text: Is it just me or does that car resemble the Trent Reznor Volvo of Despair?  Where's Ben Stiller when you need him?

name: toughasnails001
text: I have ridden in my friend's uncle's Galaxie. It is hella rude.

name: asherdan
text: A comment left by asherdan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ButterMoths, TheGrouch, PresterJohn, GeyserShitdick, farqussus, michellemarie, cellphonedick, Afkpuz, Epicurus, jmmfgd)

text: A comment left by asherdan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ButterMoths, TheGrouch, rowboat, farqussus, cailetshadow, Epicurus)

name: keithcozz
text: A FOUR?  Are you shitting me?

name: samodrei
text: 4.1 now.

name: f1shst1ck
text: One of my very favorite story arcs is about to begin :)

name: cameasiam
text: Panel seven is a fukkin 5!

name: lahnnabell
text: I love Beef's transformation from fear/reluctance to utter amazment with little fist shakies.

name: drskradley
text: Banned in six states?

name: tbtabby
text: That confused me too. How would you enforce such a ban? The only state that could get away with it is Hawaii.

name: morypcaina
text: If it pollutes too much to pass emissions tests then it can't pass inspection, and without a legal sticker from at least some state, you might get pulled over.

name: qatmandu
text: Man, I LOVE that fuckin'car!  My brother had a '65 Galaxie EXACTLY like that! Except it wasn't a convertible, and it was a 4-door.  And it didn't have the 427.  But otherwise it was EXACTLY like that!

name: atmus
text:
To be fair, none of the Galaxies came with the Cammer engine. You had to buy it seperate and install it yourself or have it installed. This is a shame, since it outperformed Chrysler's Hemi engine by a good margine, but wasn't aproved for the racing circuits because it was never a factory option.

As a side note, I saw a Galaxie with the cammer engine installed for sale a few years ago. $3k for the car sans engine, $35k for the car with engine. At the time I had $0k, so I bought neither.

name: troy_convers
text: Chubbied for the Cammer (SOHC) reference

name: cuddlefish
text: 4.1 - 4.2 I'm here allllll night

name: thegrayhoodie
text: I love this strip so much, I'm going to check if Peel-Out Summer is available through Netflix. Also, this:

name: laserblade
text: Yes. This.

name: donnatron
text: That is one rad picture.

name: woodenteeth
text:
Every now and then, I see Real Life Cats photoshopped on Assetbar, none of the anthropomorphism in their expression and, you know, it does as much for me as LOLCATs.

I didn't Lame this though... that's for idiots. A for effort.

name: rbisme
text: How do you get alt text.

name: invidious
text: Hold down the "Alt" key and refresh the page.  New text appears.

name: kamet
text: The pause in panel 7 just MAKES it for me.. "no way... no... WAY" priceless pause comedy.

name: madnes
text: Ray sticking his tongue out in panel 7 similarly does it for me.

name: big_city_nights
text: David Berkowitz's car!

name: lux
text: Panel 2 belongs in the Hall of Beef Expressions

name: donnatron
text: The way Beef opens just one eye at first makes me happy

name: rumblefish
text: I'm choosing to believe that this is brought on by childhood memories of Ray saying "Now open your eyes." and then hitting Beef in the head with a bat.

name: professorriffs
text: This really is what it's like to have your mind blown by something so radical.

name: fedallah
text: I believe my father once totaled a car exactly like this one.  The best part: it wasn't his.

name: random_shorts
text: Really? Not ONE comment about what a completely rad friend Ray is for buying Beef a '65 Galaxie with the Cammer 427?
